Posts.EditableText: Ok, one more question with the RandomChance script, is it possible to base it on an object's attributes instead of just an integer? For example, let's say your character has an attribute called "luck" and if you push a button, there is a (your luck score)% chance to move a cheeseburger into the room.
Posts.HTML: Ok, one more question with the RandomChance script, is it possible to base it on an object's attributes instead of just an integer? For example, let's say your character has an attribute called "luck" and if you push a button, there is a (your luck score)% chance to move a cheeseburger into the room.

Posts.EditableText:
You can pass any value to RandomChance () for example if you have an attribute player.luck you can call
[code:338szg89]RandomChance (player.luck)[/code:338szg89] In this case maximum luck must be 100.
Posts.HTML:
You can pass any value to RandomChance () for example if you have an attribute player.luck you can call
RandomChance (player.luck)
In this case maximum luck must be 100.
